Pre-Game Insights: Lithuania take on Cyprus at Dariaus Ir Gireno Stadium in round one of the group phase of the UEFA Nations League.
Lithuania are ranked 135th in the FIFA world ranking, while Cyprus are ranked 127th.
Lithuania are favoured by the bookmakers for the win, but it could be a tight match.
Lithuania scored six times in their last ten outings, averaging 0.6 goals per game, and conceded 17 goals with two clean sheets.
Cyprus averaged 0.8 goals per game in their last ten matches, scoring eight goals and conceding 17, with four clean sheets.
Lithuania lost 1-0 against Cyprus, beat Gibraltar 1-0, and won 1-0 against Gibraltar in their previous three matches.
Cyprus lost 1-0 to Serbia, lost 3-2 to Moldova, and won 4-1 against San Marino in their last three matches.
Both Lithuania and Cyprus are having a hard time finding their way to the net, suggesting a low scoring match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lithuania have conceded in 18 of their last 20 home matches.
Lithuania have not won 14 of their last 16 home matches.
In 7 of the last 8 home matches Lithuania played, both teams scored.
In 12 of the last 14 Lithuania matches in the UEFA Nations League C, the sum of goals was under 3.5.
In the last 3 Lithuania matches in the UEFA Nations League C, the sum of goals was under 1.5.
In the last 11 Cyprus away matches, the sum of goals was over 2.5.
Cyprus have not won 22 of their last 24 away matches.
Cyprus have not won their last 10 away matches in a row in the UEFA Nations League C.
Cyprus have conceded in 23 of their last 25 away matches.
In 9 of the last 10 Cyprus away matches, the sum of goals was over 3.5.
